intro: Tetranthera sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
